song_name: All I Want for Christmas Is You - Mariah Carey
puzzle: Mariah hits a note so high only dogs (and angels like you) can hear it.
hints: It's higher than Falsetto.
I try to do it but you're better at it :(
Can you send me a voice message doing it?

hints: It rhymes with 'sweet', like you #CuteGirl.

Joel tries to do it every Sunday at Church. #Pray #Preach

picture_note: #ChristmasEve #BestDayEver #LoveYouSoMuch
song_name: Rockin' Around The Christmas Tree - Brenda Lee
puzzle: This song makes us want to dance! It has a bouncy 'long-short' rhythm common in Jazz. What is this groovy feel called?
hints: Jazz musicians love it.
It makes me want to dance with you.
Maybe we can learn some together?

picture_note: Ich war da richtig traurig weil ich dann wieder nach München fahren musste, I miss you!

hints: Everyone had to do it in school.
There's about 1000 different kinds of these instruments.
It starts with P.

puzzle: Ariana sings high and sweet (kind of like you). What is the name for the highest female voice type in a choir?
hints: There's two types (1 and 2).
You sing in the better one.
You will be the greatest at it one day!

picture_note: #WeLoveJona

puzzle: Before the main song starts and Michael begins to sing, the orchestra plays a short opening section.
hints: Moin Leude, Trymacs hier was geht ab.
Can we have one for us?
It's at the very beginning.

picture_note: Prag Mäuse

hints: The 'C' in a C-Major chord.
You can use it to solve quadratic equations.

hints: Not the melody, but the support.
Makes everything sound fuller.
It just works together.

Opposite of Minor (sad).

puzzle: Clip-clop, clip-clop! The horse keeps the timing perfectly. What is the element of music that deals with time and duration?
hints: It's not melody or harmony.
You can tap it with your hands or feet.
Makes you want to dance with me!

Not the harmony.
You and I could make one together.

hints: You are part of one!
A group of singers.
You find them in church.

hints: It sounds electronic.
At the time it was new
Common in 80s pop.

picture_note: Juhu #ILoveBagel #BestBreakfastEver
song_name: Driving Home for Christmas - Chris Rea
puzzle: I'm driving to see you! In a pop song, what is the section that connects the Verse to the Chorus (like a road connects two places)?
hints: Connects two sections.
In the real world you walk over it.
It goes over water.

picture_note: Ich mag mit dir mit dem Zug fahren, am meisten mag ich mich bei dir anlehnen juhu
puzzle: Elvis is sad and 'Blue'. There is a whole genre of American music named after this emotion (and color). What is it?
hints: B.B. King played this style.
Known for the '12-bar' form.
Popular in the early 20th century.

picture_note: Frankfurt unsicher machen!

hints: Dates back to medieval times.
Often tells a story.
Can be a love song, maybe about us?

You would be our leader!
Think italian mi amore.

hints: Look at the artist name!
Usually includes drums, guitar, bass, keyboards.
You and I can start one and call it LJ Rockers!

hints: Opposite of electric.

picture_note: Ich mag die Bilder von uns auf dem Turm, I love you

hints: Popularized by jazz bassists like Ray Brown and Paul Chambers.

Walking in a Winter Wonderland.

I love when you sing one for me or Maria.
